title: Dajipur Hill Station
subtitle: The Wildlife Heaven in the Sahyadri Range near Radhanagari
overview: Nestled in the dense forests of the Sahyadri mountain range, Dajipur Hill Station, also known as the Dajipur Wildlife Sanctuary, is a tranquil retreat located near Radhanagari in Kolhapur district.

This region is a paradise for nature lovers, offering scenic hills, lush greenery, cascading waterfalls, and the chance to spot rare wildlife including the Indian bison (Gaur), deer, and a variety of bird species.
The untouched charm of Dajipur makes it an ideal destination for trekking, jungle safaris, and peaceful nature walks away from the bustling city life.

highlights.title: Dajipur Wildlife Sanctuary
highlights.description: Home to Indian bison, deer, peacocks, and leopards spread across the verdant Western Ghats.

highlights.title: Radhanagari Dam Backwaters
highlights.description: A scenic water reservoir offering picturesque views and boating opportunities amid misty hills.

geography.intro: Located about 120 km from Kolhapur, Dajipur sits on the border of Sindhudurg and Kolhapur districts, surrounded by dense forests and rolling Sahyadri hills.

climate.description: Dajipur experiences a cool and refreshing climate throughout the year, with heavy monsoon rains enhancing its green beauty.

seasons.text: Summer (March–May): Mild temperatures, pleasant mornings and evenings.
Monsoon (June–September): Ideal for greenery and waterfalls; trekking may be challenging due to heavy rain.

geography.conclusion: The geographical diversity of Dajipur, with its forested slopes and water bodies, makes it a perfect spot for eco-tourism and adventure.

activities.title: Wildlife Safari
activities.description: Explore the Dajipur Sanctuary in jeeps to spot Indian bison, sambar, barking deer, and peacocks.
info: Guided forest safaris available through local forest department.
Best time: Early morning or late evening.

activities.title: Trekking Trails
activities.description: Several trails wind through lush forests and hills, ideal for beginners and moderate trekkers.
info: Carry proper gear and insect repellent.
Trekking permits may be required in certain areas.

activities.title: Boating & Nature Walks
activities.description: Enjoy boating near Radhanagari Dam or take peaceful walks through the sanctuary pathways.
info: Local guides available for nature walks.

attractions.title: Radhanagari Dam
attractions.description: Built on the Bhogawati River, this massive dam is surrounded by misty hills and serves as a scenic picnic spot.

attractions.title: Kalammawadi Dam
attractions.description: A serene dam located nearby offering calm waters, boating, and beautiful sunset views.

marineLife.intro: Being a forested hill area, Dajipur does not feature marine life but is rich in terrestrial and avian biodiversity.

items.title: Bird Watching
items.description: Spot hornbills, peacocks, and various migratory birds in the sanctuary.

items.title: Forest Fauna
items.description: Indian bison, leopards, deer, and wild boar inhabit the dense forest.

conclusion: Dajipur is a wildlife haven within Maharashtra’s hill belts.
It provides an immersive experience of the Western Ghats’ natural wealth.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Dajipur is well connected via Kolhapur–Radhanagari road.
Buses and private vehicles are available from Kolhapur (120 km).

bookingTips.description: Plan your visit between October and February for the most pleasant weather.
Carry eco-friendly items and avoid plastic waste within sanctuary limits.
Limited accommodation available near sanctuary; advance booking is recommended.
